changelog.info: Add a new command to take 30 sequential measurements to allow the client tools to work out the device stability over a short amount of time.

Take multiple pulse counts from the sensor and increase the integral time by up to a factor of 4 for very black samples. This improves the accuracy of the readings when measuring dark patches without slowing down bright patches.
Add commands to get and set an optional owner name and email.
changelog.warning: You need to check that any client accessing the hardware has colorhug-client 0.1.5 or newer installed. If older versions are used then timeout errors may cause the calibration to fail when reading very dark patches.

changelog.info: Do not lock up the device if the host crashes mid-read. This should also fix using the device in HID mode which is needed for driver-less operation in Windows and OSX.

Make the black readings more precise by waiting for the first pulse before starting the timing loop and use the integral period up until the last rising edge. This should remove the small color tints for very low light readings.
Always use the factory XYZ calibration as well as the ccmx matrix when getting readings.
Allow setting the lost-or-stolen flag when in firmware mode.
Return the correct error if the EEPROM unlock code was incorrect.
Multiply the dRGB values by the post-scale before using the calibration matrix.
Add calibration remapping functionality to be able to specify default matrixes for LCD, CRT and projectors.
Use a better packed float multiplication algorithm to improve XYZ measurement accuracy.
Add a calibration matrix display type bitfield to each calibration record so the user can't match LCD matrices to projectors and vice versa.
